result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie L Medved was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time served 56 Days.
Defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Case #12CF1479.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution:  $500.00 to ValuCare and $1,857.99 to Pharmacy Mutual Insurance.  JOINT and SEVERAL WITH CO-ACTORS.  To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision at the rate of $50.00 per month starting the 6th month of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs and Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision at the rate of $50.00 per month starting after Restitution has been Paid In Full.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Be involved in AA, 12 step program and have a sponsor.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
No contact with Walgreens on Sunset, Anne B., ValuCare on South Grand, Randy D. and Co-Actors.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case #14CF1057 was Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF1457.

supervisions.notes:
CASE RE-SENTENCED
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

AS OF 10/21/16: Add language that prior sentence on 1/29/15 is vacated.

AMENDED 11-22-2016:  Defendant is entitled to 56 days sentence credit (original sentence) plus an additional 631 days (from 01-29-2015 to 10-21-2016) for the time the defendant was incarcerated up to re-sentence.  TOTAL SENTENCE CREDIT OF 687 DAYS.

AS OF 2/09/2017: Correct to read as follows: 1-29-2015 to 10-13-2016 for a Total of sentence credit of 679 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid JOINT AND SEVERAL to the Agent at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing the 6th month of supervision for: 
ValuCare in the amount of $500.00
Pharmacy Mutual Insurance in the amount of $1,857.99
Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: Walgreens on Sunset, Anne B., ValuCare on Sount Grand, Randy D., or co-actors.  Follow though with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Katie L Medved in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DEFENDANT NEEDS ID PROCESSING

Plea Colloquy.  Court questions why a no contest plea.  Statements by Atty. Bricco and the State.  Court will reject a no contest plea. Defendant agrees she will enter a guilty plea.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 7 and 8 are dismissed and read in.

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1

Imposed Sentence of:

12 years Imprisonment (Credit -  56 days) CONCURRENT TO 12CF1479
- 7 Years of Initial Confinement
-  5 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- No Use or Possession of  illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with Walgreens on Sunset, Anne B., ValuCare on South Grand, Randy D. and co-actors.
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Restitution: $500.00 to ValuCare and $1,857.99 to Pharmacy Mutual Insurance.    JOINT AND SEVERAL WITH CO-ACTORS (to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing the 6th month of supervision)

Costs: $278.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


COUNT 2

Imposed Sentence of:

3 years Imprisonment CONSEUCTIVE TO COUNT 1
- 1 Years  6 months of Initial Confinement
- 1 Years 6 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:  SAME AS COUNT 1

Costs: $ 268.00
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
( Costs and surcharges to be paid as a condition of extended supervison at the rate of $50.00  per month commencing after restitution as been paid. ) 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
